message.content:
Here's a JavaScript function that uses regex to extract a three character code from a filename in the specified format:

```javascript
function extractCode(filename) {
    const regex = /^(\d{2})-([a-zA-Z]{3})\.usfm$/;
    return filename.match(regex)[2];
}
```

You can use this function by passing the filename as an argument, like so:

```javascript
console.log(extractCode("57-1Jn.usfm")); // Outputs: "1Jn"
```

In the code above:

- `^` and `$` are anchor characters that match the start and end of the string respectively.
- `\d{2}` matches exactly two digits.
- `-` matches the hyphen between the numbers and the three character code.
- `[a-zA-Z]{3}` matches any 3 alphabetic characters (upper or lower case).
- `\.usfm$` matches the file extension ".usfm" at the end of the string.
